meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Stellaria, typically with small white flowers.
meanings.sent1: The garden had beautiful stitchworts blooming near the fence.
meanings.sent2: I picked some stitchworts to put in a vase on the table.
meanings.sent3: The stitchworts in the garden seemed to be whispering secrets to each other.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as delicate and pure as a cluster of stitchworts.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the stitchworts filled the air with a sweet, fresh scent.

meanings.definition: Any plant of the genus Stellaria.
meanings.sent1: We learned about different stitchworts in our botany class.
meanings.sent2: The field was covered in various stitchworts, each unique in its own way.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid its acorns among the stitchworts to confuse the birds.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden of thoughts, each one a different stitchworts plant.
meanings.sent5: The forest was a tapestry of colors, with stitchworts adding a touch of white.

meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Stellaria, with small white flowers.
meanings.sent1: The tiny stitchworts in the meadow looked like little stars on the ground.
meanings.sent2: She carefully watered the delicate stitchworts in her garden.
meanings.sent3: The stitchworts giggled as the breeze tickled their petals.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a field of stitchworts swaying in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight made the stitchworts glow like tiny lanterns in the dark.
